description:
Simple unit test, written mostly just to become familiar with the code.

I've addressed the comments and added the test to the visual studio project.  I'll commit when the tree opens.

Committed: http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome?view=rev&revision=2249

messages.text:
Quick unit test of existing code
Wrote this while learning the code
Exercises message pump a bit, too.

Passes on Linux with my message pump, 
I'll test it on Windows on Monday.

LGTM

http://codereview.chromium.org/3049/diff/1/3
File net/base/test_completion_callback_unittest.cc (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/3049/diff/1/3#newcode39
Line 39: class ExampleEmployer::ExampleWorker : public base::RefCountedThreadSafe<ExampleWorker> {
nit :wrap lines at 80 chars.  search the repository for "public base::RefCountedThreadSafe" to see how this case is typically formatted.

http://codereview.chromium.org/3049/diff/1/3#newcode91
Line 91: ;
nit: please nix the extraneous semicolon for consistency with existing chrome code.

http://codereview.chromium.org/3049/diff/1/3#newcode95
Line 95: ;
ditto

http://codereview.chromium.org/3049/diff/1/3#newcode125
Line 125: } // namespace
we usually do not put TESTs inside anonymous namespaces.  is that something commonly done in google3?

subject: Simple unit test, written mostly just to become familiar with the code
